intro: Liabum peruense, commonly known as the Peruvian liabum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, lance-shaped leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shrublands and forest edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
